statement: B. Roadside Trees (Simplified Edition)time limit per test2 secondsmemory limit per test256 megabytesinputstdinoutputstdoutSquirrel Liss loves nuts. There arentrees (numbered1tonfrom west to east) along a street and there is a delicious nut on the top of each tree. The height of the treeiishi. Liss wants to eat all nuts.Now Liss is on the root of the tree with the number1. In one second Liss can perform one of the following actions:Walk up or down one unit on a tree.Eat a nut on the top of the current tree.Jump to the next tree. In this action the height of Liss doesn't change. More formally, when Liss is at heighthof the treei(1 ≤i≤n- 1), she jumps to heighthof the treei+ 1.
